revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Sprint |model=Overdrive |revision=3G/4G Mobile Hotspot |asin= |fcc_date=12/08/2009 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Sierra Wireless |manuf_model=AirCard W801 |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=mobile hotspot, WiMAX modem, 3G mobile router |fcc_id=N7N-MHS801,N7N-MC5728 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88AP310 |cpu1_cspeed=624 |fla1=256 |fla1_brand=Hynix |fla1_model=H8BCS0SI0MBR |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H8BCS0SI0MBR |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (USB only) |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=SyChip WLAN8688 |wi1_module_if=SDIO |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8688 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi2_module=Sierra Wireless AirPrime MC5728V |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe (USB only) |wi2_chip1_brand=Beceem |wi2_chip1_model=BCSM250 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=CDMA/WiMAX |wi2_ant_conn= |eth_none=true |flags=3G (CDMA), 4G (WiMAX), portable |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=Overdrive-XXX |default_ssid_regex=^Overdrive-[A-F0-9]{3}$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user= |default_pass=password |oui=00:0B:6C }} {{TagLine|3G/4G Mobile Hotspot}} :[http://www.sierrawireless.com/productsandservices/AirCard/MobileHotspots/AirCardW801.aspx Product page] ([[Sierra Wireless]] AirCard W801) {{â€¢}} [http://support.sprint.com/global/pdf/user_guides/sierra_wireless/overdrive_3g4g/overdrive_3g4g_sierra_wireless_ug.pdf Manual]
The Hynix RAM/DDR chip appears to be [http://www.ubmtechinsights.com/reports-and-subscriptions/open-market-reports/Report-Profile/?ReportKey=7371 256MB Flash + 128MB RAM].
*The device has a [[Sierra Wireless AirPrime MC5728V]] card on-board. :FCC ID: N7N-MC5728 - WiMAX Mini PCIe (USB) Card :The WiMAX portion is manned by a [[Beceem]] BCSM250. *The 802.11b/g wireless module is from ''SyChip'' and may be [[Marvell]] :88W8688 based (marked 000B6C, BD92A9, VYKFHK, LBWA-EP)
The default SSID for the devices seems to be '''Overdrive-XXX''' where :'''XXX''' is the last three hex digits of the WiFi MAC address.
